landing.description: A backend-independent client-side annotation framework designed to:
landing.modularNature: Through its modular nature Arethusa can be configured to solve different use cases.
landing.devDescription: Arethusa is built on the AngularJS javascript web application framework and provides a back-end independent plugin infrastructure for accessing texts, annotations and linguistic services from a variety of sources. Extensibility is a guiding design goal - Arethusa includes tools for automatic generation of new plugin skeletons (Arethusa::CLI) and detailed development guides are currently in progress, with the hopes that others will be able to reuse and build upon the platform to add support for other annotation types, languages and back-end repositories and workflow engines.
landing.fundersDescription: This project has received support from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, the Institute of Museum and Library Services and the European Social Fund.
landing.goalsDescription:
• Make annotating accessible and enjoyable, lowering the entry barrier for the user by providing access to related resources and services at the point of annotation.
  • Make the developer's job easier, by giving her tools and a framework for adding new functionality in a modular fashion and for binding diverse resources together in new ways.
  • Be fully open and have the ability to participate in external workflows that route digital content, together with its provenance, to and from diverse destinations.

errorDialog.sendHint: To send details of this error to us for investigation, please supply a brief description of what you were doing, check the 'Include Screenshot' checkbox to include the full error details, and click 'Next' to complete the steps to send. Then click 'Close' when done (or to skip sending).
